text: when you're without young and as a
parent of young children absolutely
everything changes
I was worried and I was quite scared
that obviously James's James had the
full-time salary coming in and mine was
a part-time carry salary
[Music]
James died very suddenly he had a stroke
episode it was a bank holiday weekend
and you know life changed from then all
the things that James and I felt that we
could provide our children with all of
that suddenly seemed to go I couldn't
find the money or the justification to
be paying after-school clubs and the
equipment that the children needed you
don't want your children to feel too
different in any way and you obviously
want to provide the best and I suppose
there's also some over compensation for
the fact that you are the only parent
and your children have suffered a huge
trauma that you had no control over that
money would have helped with day to day
costs for the children new uniforms the
cost of their education the cost of
school trips
yes I'd probably pay for more therapy
for the children
so this would have been money that James
would have paid through his national
insurance contributions throughout his
working life he was 41 when he died it
works as he was 18 and I wonder what's
happened to that money he was their
father in every way I feel that he's now
not being treated as their parent and
the children aren't allowed his
contributions
